Investigators cautious in murder of anti-drug activist's brother, probing possible DZ Mafia links
subhead: A silent march is being held on Saturday in honor of Mehdi Kessaci, a young man killed in Marseille. Investigators have not ruled out anything as they work to identify the hit squad. One leading line of inquiry is that the contract for the murder may have been ordered from inside prison.

Sex, lies and bicycles: Espionage scandal rocks Denmark
subhead: The head of the Danish intelligence services allegedly provided false information to political leaders in the Kingdom of Denmark to justify placing the director of military intelligence under surveillance for nearly a year.

title: Brazil's ex-leader Bolsonaro taken into custody over flight risk
subhead: Brazil's Supreme Court ordered the pre-emptive arrest of the former president on Saturday, after a judge said he was preparing to flee just days before starting his 27-year sentence for leading an attempted coup.

title: The fall of Northvolt, Sweden's symbol of green reindustrialization
subhead: On March 12, the electric battery giant shut its doors for good. Nearly 5,000 people employed at the Skelleftea gigafactory lost their jobs. As the US-based company Lyten prepares to restart production, Northvolt's downfall has cast a chill over Sweden's ambitions to reindustrialize around clean technology.

title: Trump's odd day: Enthralled by Socialist Zohran Mamdani and abandoned by MAGA lawmaker Marjorie Taylor Greene
subhead: The US president lavished praise on New York City's mayor-elect during a White House visit on Friday. Almost simultaneously, one of his most fervent allies announced her resignation from the House of Representatives, formalizing her break with the Republican leader.

'He looked me up and down': Hostesses, flight attendants and waitresses speak out about everyday sexualization
subhead: Crude jokes, inappropriate stares and overt flirting are commonplace for women in service jobs where physical appearance is paramount. Employees remain poorly protected from this sexualization, which can amount to harassment.

title: Activist Amine Kessaci: 'No, I will not stay silent. I will say and repeat that my brother Mehdi died for nothing. I will speak out about the violence of drug trafficking'
subhead: Known for his fight against the devastation caused by drug trafficking in the working-class neighborhoods of Marseille, the brother of Mehdi, aged 20, who was murdered on November 13, denounces 'the cowardice of those who order these crimes' and urges the French state to 'understand that a fight to the death is underway.'

title: Inequality on the rise in France amid a staggering surge in income among the ultrarich
subhead: The wealthiest 0.1% of French people earn, on average, 167 times more than the quarter of households with the lowest incomes, according to France's National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies. The gap has widened dramatically over the past 20 years, while reforms introduced by Emmanuel Macron have reduced the tax rate for the richest households.
